api.p1: The following API is respect to the default plugins and may vary. Please refer the the developer's plugin page.
api.p2: When you pass a phrase, there are three notations that can be used to tell gengo how to look up your definitions. See Dictionary for setup.

ul1.li1: The phrase to look for in the requested locale.

ul3.li1: The phrase to look for in the requested locale.

ul4.li1: Searches for the definition directly, assuming there are no sub-keys for the phrase in your dictionary.

ul5.li1: Searches for the definition assuming a phrase may contain a sub-key or a key that is dotted and may also contain a sub-key.

ul6.li1: Searches for the definition by searching the dictionary's object in a dotted way.

intro.p1: gengo.js is a server agnostic i18n/l10n library that is powered by it's very small core. Along with the core, it is also managed by six plugins. The combinations of the these create a powerful and a unique library that enables developers to take over the core and extend its capabilities. The core is essentially a unit that provides the basics such as a way of accessing a plugin's options or the plugin itself.
intro.p2:
You can simply initialize gengo.js by requiring and configuring it.
See Options.
